title: Do you also feel that it is actually difficult to work on an iPad rather than simply working on a laptop? - Quora

response.answer_text: Work on what?  I’d never like to draw or sketch on a laptop (as if I could anyway :p) I’d never be able to write programs in an IDE on an iPad or heck, even an android tablet for that matter. Each has its use case and if someone says that xyz is an all-in-one, then there inevitably, will be hidden compromises. I’d never say that an iPad Pro is an all in one. Combined with the magic keyboard, it’s actually heavier than a MacBook Air, and much much more than some chromebooks. I’d never say that the surface Pro X is an all in one. It’s doesn’t even run all the apps they give on the Microsoft Store. The perfect all in one doesn’t exist because it cannot (as of yet) Till then, certain things will be difficult to work on an iPad. And other, on a laptop.

I haven’t used iPad yet, but I can agree that people find it difficult. Different operating system and software could be a problem. If you're using Windows on a laptop then you can do multitasking easily.
